main_definition: Milk is a nutrient-rich liquid produced by the mammary glands of female mammals, which is commonly used as food or beverage.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To exploit something for personal gain
meanings_and_examples.example: The company was accused of milking its suppliers by charging excessively high prices.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To extract the maximum benefit or value from a resource or situation
meanings_and_examples.example: They managed to milk every last bit of profit out of their successful business venture.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An idiomatic expression meaning getting more than what is fair, typically money
meanings_and_examples.example: The manager was accused of milking the company by taking extravagant vacations on company dime.
